instructions.instruction: Heat a pan over medium heat.
Butter one side of each bread slice generously.
Place one slice butter-side down in the pan. Add cheese on top.
Top with the second slice, butter-side up.
Cook until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip carefully with spatula and cook the other side until golden and cheese is melted.
Remove from heat, let cool for 30 seconds, then slice and serve!
Crack eggs into a bowl.
Add milk, salt, and pepper. Whisk until well combined and slightly frothy.
Heat butter in a pan over medium-low heat until melted and foamy.
Pour in egg mixture. Let sit for 20 seconds without stirring.
Gently stir and fold eggs with a spatula, creating soft curds. Cook until just set but still creamy.
Remove from heat immediately (eggs will continue cooking). Serve warm!
Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add spaghetti and cook according to package directions.
While pasta cooks, cut bacon into small pieces and fry in a large pan until crispy. Remove from heat.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated parmesan, and lots of black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water, then drain spaghetti.
Add hot pasta to the pan with bacon (off heat). Quickly stir in egg mixture, tossing constantly.
Add pasta water a little at a time to create a creamy sauce. The residual heat will cook the eggs without scrambling.
Serve immediately with extra parmesan and black pepper!
Wash all vegetables thoroughly under cold water.
Tear lettuce into bite-sized pieces and place in a large bowl.
Dice tomatoes and cucumber into small chunks.
Add tomatoes and cucumber to the bowl with lettuce.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt to taste.
Toss everything together gently and serve fresh!
Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces or thin strips.
Heat a pan over medium-high heat. Cook chicken until golden and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes.
Warm tortillas in a dry pan or microwave for 15 seconds each.
Shred lettuce into thin strips.
Assemble tacos: place chicken on tortillas, top with lettuce, cheese, and a dollop of sour cream.
Fold and enjoy your delicious tacos!
Dice onion and mince garlic cloves.
Roughly chop tomatoes (if using fresh).
In a large pot, sauté onion and garlic in a little oil until soft and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add tomatoes and broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Use an immersion blender (or regular blender in batches) to puree until smooth.
Stir in cream and heat through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with crusty bread for dipping!
If using day-old rice, break up any clumps. Fresh rice should be cooled first.
Chop vegetables into small, uniform pieces.
Beat eggs in a bowl.
Heat oil in a wok or large pan over high heat until shimmering.
Scramble eggs quickly, breaking into small pieces. Remove and set aside.
Add vegetables to the wok, stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until tender-crisp.
Add rice, breaking up clumps. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until heated through.
Add soy sauce and scrambled eggs back in. Toss everything together for 1 minute.
Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve hot!
Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil.
Add pasta and cook according to package directions, usually 8-12 minutes.
Reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water before draining.
Drain pasta and return to the pot (off heat).
Add butter and toss until melted and pasta is coated.
Add grated parmesan cheese and a splash of pasta water. Toss until creamy.
Season with salt to taste and serve immediately!
Wash all vegetables thoroughly. Cut broccoli into florets, slice carrots, and dice bell peppers.
Mince garlic cloves.
Heat oil in a wok or large pan over high heat until very hot.
Add garlic, stir for 10 seconds until fragrant (don't let it burn!).
Add carrots first, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Add broccoli and bell peppers, stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp.
Pour soy sauce over vegetables, toss for 30 seconds to coat evenly.
Remove from heat immediately to keep veggies crisp. Serve over rice!
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, and baking powder.
In another bowl, whisk eggs and milk until well combined.
Melt butter and let it cool slightly.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients. Stir gently until just combined (lumps are okay!).
Heat a pan over medium heat. Lightly grease with butter.
Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake. Cook until bubbles form on surface, about 2 minutes.
Flip and cook until golden brown on the other side, about 1-2 minutes.
Repeat with remaining batter. Serve warm with syrup and butter!
Toast the bread slices until golden brown.
While bread is toasting, cut avocado in half and remove pit.
Scoop avocado into a bowl and mash with a fork.
Add a squeeze of lime juice, salt, and pepper to the mashed avocado.
Spread the avocado mixture evenly on toasted bread.
Optionally top with extra black pepper or red pepper flakes.
In a jar or container, combine 1/2 cup oats with 1/2 cup milk.
Add 1 tablespoon peanut butter and 1 teaspoon honey.
Slice half a banana and add to the mixture.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and stir well to combine.
Cover and refrigerate overnight (at least 4 hours).
In the morning, stir and enjoy cold or warmed up.
Drain and rinse black beans.
In a pan, heat beans with cumin, chili powder, and salt.
Mash beans slightly while heating.
Dice tomato and onion, chop cilantro.
Warm tortillas in a dry pan or microwave.
Fill tortillas with beans.
Top with diced tomato, onion, avocado, cilantro, and lime juice.
Serve immediately.
Slice tomatoes into 1/4 inch thick rounds.
Slice mozzarella into 1/4 inch thick rounds.
Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices alternating on a plate.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between slices.
Drizzle with olive oil.
Sprinkle with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Serve immediately at room temperature.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Chop all vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
Mince garlic and ginger.
Heat oil in a large pan or wok over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add harder vegetables (carrot, broccoli) first, stir-fry 3 minutes.
Add softer vegetables (bell pepper, onion), stir-fry 2 minutes.
Add soy sauce and toss to coat.
Serve over rice.
Rinse lentils and set aside.
Dice onion and tomatoes, mince garlic and ginger.
Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Sauté onion until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, ginger, and spices, cook for 1 minute.
Add lentils, tomatoes, and vegetable broth.
Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes.
Stir in coconut milk and spinach, cook until spinach wilts.
Season with salt and serve over rice.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cube sweet potato and toss with olive oil, paprika, cumin, and salt.
Roast sweet potato for 25-30 minutes until tender.
Cook quinoa according to package directions.
Drain and rinse chickpeas.
Massage kale with a bit of olive oil and lemon juice.
Make tahini dressing: mix tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and water.
Assemble bowls with quinoa, sweet potato, chickpeas, kale, and avocado.
Drizzle with tahini dressing and serve.
Heat a pan over medium heat.
Butter one side of a tortilla.
Place tortilla butter-side down in pan.
Sprinkle cheese evenly over half the tortilla.
Fold tortilla in half over the cheese.
Cook until bottom is golden, about 2-3 minutes.
Carefully flip and cook other side until golden.
Remove from pan, cut into wedges, and serve.
Cook rice and let cool (day-old rice works best).
Dice chicken into small pieces.
Dice carrot and onion, mince garlic.
Heat oil in a large pan or wok over high heat.
Cook chicken until no longer pink, remove from pan.
Add more oil, scramble eggs, remove from pan.
Add vegetables, stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Add rice, breaking up clumps, stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Return chicken and eggs to pan, add soy sauce.
Toss everything together and serve hot.
Add all ingredients to blender.
Blend on high until smooth and creamy.
Taste and add more honey if needed.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.
Dice onion, bell pepper, and tomatoes, mince garlic.
Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Sauté onion and bell pepper until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and spices, cook for 1 minute.
Add tomatoes, beans, and vegetable broth.
Bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes.
Season with salt to taste.
Serve hot, optionally topped with cheese and sour cream.
Cut avocados in half, remove pits, and scoop into bowl.
Mash avocados with fork to desired consistency.
Dice tomato, onion, and jalapeño finely.
Chop cilantro.
Add all ingredients to mashed avocado.
Squeeze lime juice over mixture.
Season with salt and pepper.
Mix gently and serve with tortilla chips.
Cook pasta according to package directions, reserve 1 cup pasta water.
While pasta cooks, melt butter in a large pan over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add heavy cream and bring to a gentle simmer.
Reduce heat and stir in parmesan cheese until melted.
Season with salt and pepper.
Drain pasta and add to sauce.
Toss to coat, adding pasta water if needed for consistency.
Serve immediately with extra parmesan.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cream together butter and sugar until fluffy.
Beat in eggs and vanilla.
In separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually mix dry ingredients into wet ingredients.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until golden brown.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring.
Heat vegetable broth in a pot and keep warm.
Slice mushrooms, dice onion, mince garlic.
Heat olive oil and butter in a large pan.
Sauté mushrooms until golden, remove and set aside.
In same pan, sauté onion until soft.
Add garlic and rice, stir for 1 minute.
Add wine and stir until absorbed.
Add broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly.
When rice is creamy and al dente, stir in mushrooms and parmesan.
Season with salt and pepper, serve immediately.
Brown ground beef in a pan over medium-high heat.
Drain excess fat.
Add taco seasoning and water according to package directions.
Simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Dice tomato and onion, shred lettuce.
Warm tortillas.
Fill tortillas with beef mixture.
Top with cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, and sour cream.
Serve immediately.
Dice onion, bell pepper, and tomatoes, mince garlic.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Sauté onion and bell pepper until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and spices, cook for 1 minute.
Add tomatoes and cook until sauce thickens, about 10 minutes.
Make 6 wells in the sauce with a spoon.
Crack an egg into each well.
Cover and cook until eggs are set to your liking, 5-8 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with bread.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl until well combined.
Refrigerate mixture for 30 minutes to firm up.
Roll mixture into 1-inch balls.
Store in refrigerator in an airtight container.
Chop cucumber, tomatoes, and bell pepper into bite-sized pieces.
Slice onion thinly.
Combine vegetables in a large bowl.
Add olives and crumbled feta cheese.
Drizzle with olive oil and fresh lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss gently and serve.
Slice cucumber, tomato, and bell pepper into thin strips.
Dice onion finely.
Lay tortilla flat and spread hummus evenly.
Add lettuce leaves to cover hummus.
Arrange sliced vegetables on top.
Roll tortilla tightly, tucking in sides as you go.
Cut in half diagonally and serve.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a baking pan.
Melt butter in microwave or on stove.
Stir in sugar until well combined.
Beat in eggs and vanilla.
Sift in cocoa powder, flour, and salt, mix gently.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Pour batter into prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 25-30 minutes (toothpick should have moist crumbs).
Cool completely before cutting into squares.
Wash and slice strawberries.
In a glass or bowl, add a layer of Greek yogurt.
Add a layer of mixed berries.
Sprinkle granola on top of berries.
Repeat layers once more.
Drizzle honey on top and serve immediately.
Dice bell pepper and onion into small pieces.
Melt butter in a pan over medium heat.
Sauté bell pepper and onion until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 1 minute.
Whisk eggs with salt and pepper in a bowl.
Pour eggs into pan and scramble, stirring frequently.
When eggs are almost set, add shredded cheese and fold in.
Remove from heat and serve immediately.
Mash 2 ripe bananas in a large bowl.
Whisk in eggs, milk, and vanilla extract.
In separate bowl, mix flour, sugar, and baking powder.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, stir until just mixed (lumps are okay).
Heat a griddle or pan over medium heat and add butter.
Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake onto hot griddle.
Cook until bubbles form on top, then flip and cook other side.
Repeat with remaining batter.
Serve warm with maple syrup.
Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface to desired thickness.
Transfer dough to a baking sheet or pizza stone.
Spread marinara sauce evenly over dough, leaving a border.
Tear mozzarella and distribute over sauce.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until crust is golden and cheese bubbles.
Remove from oven and top with fresh basil leaves.
Let cool for 2 minutes, then slice and serve.
